Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security Subcommittee

item.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Financial Management, the Budget, and International Security.

item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

summary.text: Amends Federal law concerning government employees to include as an employee, for purposes of Federal retirement benefits, a U.S. citizen who was employed by Air America, Inc., its subsidiary Air Asia Company Limited, or the Pacific Division of Southern Air Transport, Inc., during the period such corporation was owned and controlled by the U.S. Government. Directs the Director of Central Intelligence to make certain payments to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund.

bill.title: A bill to amend chapters 83 and 84 of title 5, United States Code, to provide Federal retirement benefits for United States citizen employees of Air America, Inc., its subsidiary Air Asia Company Limited, or the Pacific Division of Southern Air Transport, Inc.

item.title: A bill to amend chapters 83 and 84 of title 5, United States Code, to provide Federal retirement benefits for United States citizen employees of Air America, Inc., its subsidiary Air Asia Company Limited, or the Pacific Division of Southern Air Transport, Inc.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
